intro: Grevillea chrysodendrum, commonly known as the golden-armed grevillea, is a striking evergreen shrub native to Western Australia. It features vibrant orange-red flowers that appear in dense, cylindrical clusters, typically from late winter to early spring. The plant has narrow, leathery leaves that are grey-green in color and covered in a fine, powdery coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal gardens. Its unique floral display and drought tolerance contribute to its appeal in both ornamental and ecological landscapes.
